cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.problem
Interface Problem

All Known Subinterfaces:
ObjectiveProblem
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseObjectiveProblem, BaseProblem, Bucket, JobShop, Knapsack, SAT, TSP
public interface Problem

Most basic problem interface - every problem must implement this.

Supplies most basic problem operations, such as initializing, getting fitness etc.

See Also:
BaseObjectiveProblem is abstract implementation of this interface along with other supplementary interfaces. Consider using it instead.

Method Detail

isSolution

boolean isSolution(Configuration configuration)
Tests if attributes is solution to this problem.

Parameters:
configuration - tested attributes
Returns:
true if attributes is solution to this problem

getDimension

int getDimension()
Returns dimension of this problem.

Returns:
dimension of problem

getDefaultFitness

Fitness getDefaultFitness()
Returns default fitness for this problem.

Default fitness is object which is able to rank any attributes so that better attributes has higher rank.

Returns:
fitness object

getOperationIterator

OperationIterator getOperationIterator(Configuration configuration)
Returns iterator for operations which are allowed for supplied attributes.

This iterator should be lazy initialized! If not, you are running into risk of performance problems (some algorithms creates lots of configurations and asks operationIterator for all of them).

Parameters:
configuration - attributes to return operationIterator for
Returns:
operatorIterator for this attributes

getConfigurationMap

ConfigurationMap getConfigurationMap()
Returns attributes mapping for this problem.

Configuration mapping maps Integers from attributes to other objects (Strings etc) 1:1.

Returns:
configuration map for this problem
See Also:
default identity implementation of map

setLabel

void setLabel(java.lang.String label)
Sets label for problem.

Note that label is important because ResultEntry uses it to distinguish between different settings of same problem.

This should be called automatically in constructor, because Solver might need to override it.

Parameters:
label - new label for problem

getLabel

java.lang.String getLabel()
Gets label of problem.

For more info, see setLabel(String).

Returns:
label for problem
